info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 22 at 6:04AM CDT until July 22 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected to continue to today in the warned area.
* WHERE...A portion of north central Kansas, including the following counties, Osborne, Phillips, Rooks and Smith.
* WHEN...Until 600 PM CDT Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings and other flood prone areas may be inundated with water and may not be passable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 604 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain from thunderstorms last evening and overnight with between 2 and 5 inches of rain estimated to have fallen. Additional rain today will be limited, but flooding will continue due to the excessive runoff. - This flood warning replaces the previously issues flash flood warnings issued for this general area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Phillipsburg, Stockton, Kensington, Agra, Kirwin, Gaylord, Glade, Athol, Speed, Harlan and Cedar. - Some creeks and streams including are the Deer Creek, Spring Creek, Big Creek, Plum Creek, West Cedar Creek, Medicine Creek and Big Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Osborne, KS; Phillips, KS; Rooks, KS; Smith, KS
